xxl.util
Class XXLSystem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.util.XXLSystem
public class XXLSystem
extends Object

The XXLSystem class contains two static methods to determine the memory size of an object. It cannot be instantiated.

The usage of this class can be seen for example in the following classes:

  • Sorter

See Also:
HashSet, Set, Array, Field, Modifier

protected static class XXLSystem.Wrapper
          This class is a Wrapper for objects with the intention to distinguish two objects if and only if they refer to the same object.

Field Detail

REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE

public static final int REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE
The size of a reference in memory.
Method Detail

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(Object object)
                         throws IllegalAccessException
This method computes the memory size of the given object. To get the memory size of the specified object, a reference to this object is needed. If this reference is null, the trivial case, the returned object size is 8 byte, because that is only the size of a reference in memory. Otherwise getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set) is called, which anaylizes the class this object is an instance of, the superclasses and especially the memory size allocated for each non-static and non-transient attribute of these classes is determined and saved in a HashSet. For further information of saving the objects in the HashSet see XXLSystem.Wrapper.
Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
See Also:
getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set)

getObjectSize

protected static int getObjectSize(Object object,
                                   Class cl,
                                   Set hs)
                            throws IllegalAccessException
The size of an object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. The algorithm starts with the reference memory size of 8 byte that is allocated for each object to hold the reference on it. Then the attributes (fields) of the class and the super classes are determined with regard to the object to be analyzed. If an attribute is a primitive type the size is added to the reference memory size.
If it is an array the size of the array's component type is computed and then multiplied with the length of the array. The resulting value is added to the reference size allocated for this array and at last 4 bytes are added needed to save the length information of an array.
Otherwise the attribute is an object and the method is called recursively adding the size of this attribute to the previous computed object size.

Overview:

primitive types:

  • int, float : 4 byte
  • byte, boolean: 1 byte
  • char, short: 2 byte
  • long, double: 8 byte

size of a reference in memory: 8 byte

size of an array: 

 8 byte (reference)
 + 4 byte (length information (int))
 + (array.length * bytes allocated component type)
All traversed attributes are inserted in a HashSet, which represents an exact image of the allocated memory concerning the given object.

Note: This HashSet is a non-cyclic graph.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
cl - the class the object to be analyzed is an instance of.
hs - the HashSet used to store the traversed attributes.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
